Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the National Climate Assessment is based on the most extreme modeled scenario.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the extreme scenario on which the National Climate Assessment is based.
Understate: The claim understates the transparency and factual basis of the National Climate Assessment.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that the report is based on an extreme scenario.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the extreme scenario used in the National Climate Assessment was pushed by the Obama administration without providing evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim suggests that there may be alternative explanations for the extreme scenario used in the report, without providing evidence to support this.
